info_remote: Sarah Cannon Network - 98 reviews - Nashville, TN 37203
description:
Description
Introduction
Do you want to join an organization that invests in you as a(an) Senior Data Engineer? At Sarah Cannon Network, you come first. HCA Healthcare has committed up to $300 million in programs to support our incredible team members over the course of three years.
Benefits
At Sarah Cannon Network, we want to ensure your needs are met. We offer eligible colleagues an attractive benefit package that includes medical, wellbeing, dental and vision benefits along with some unique benefits including:
Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Flexible Spending
Paid Time Off (PTO) and Personal Leave
401K (100% annual match - 3% to 9% of pay based on years of service)
Academic Assistance and Reimbursements for Tuition and Student Loans
Employee Discounts including Tickets, Retail, Mental Health Apps, Education Apps, Identity Theft Protection etc.
Home, Auto, and Pet Insurance
Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)
Short Term & Long Term Disability coverage
Adoption Assistance
Legal Benefits and lots more!
Learn more about Employee Benefits
You contribute to our success. Every role has an impact on our patients’ lives and you have the opportunity to make a difference. We are looking for a dedicated Senior Data Engineer like you to be a part of our team.
Job Summary and Qualifications
Position Summary
The Data Engineer is responsible for the design and development of data pipelines from source systems to data warehouses, optimizing the data processes needed to power a broad range of large-scale BI products. This position requires working with cross-functional teams to translate business and clinical needs into reporting structures that are easily consumed by BI, and a willingness to learn the subject-matter necessary to develop and implement clinical data requirements. The Data Engineer is a seasoned professional in data structures, warehousing, and BI who thrives on a team dedicated to developing and supporting products that promote clinical care excellence at HCA.
Major Responsibilities:
Design ETL processes that integrate disparate data into a common data model for BI delivery (gather requirements, design, develop, test, and debug).
Implement required infrastructure for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from various data sources.
Architect and optimize data solutions to power large-scale BI applications.
Understand and translate strategic business needs into a flexible and scalable data architecture.
Design and develop data models combining data from multiple complex and disparate data sources into a homogenous format for reporting.
Ensure the effective design, build, deployment, documentation and maintenance of reports against relational and multidimensional databases to support end-user processes.
Serve as the first-line responder for issues related to the data, architecture, and ETL powering the BI product portfolio.
Facilitate effective communication among all team members and leadership to ensure comprehensive understanding of needs, expectations, and requirements.
Performs other duties as assigned
Practices and adheres to the “Code of Conduct” philosophy and “Mission and Value Statement.”
Education & Experience:
Bachelor's degree preferred in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Required
Master's degree Preferred
3+ years of experience in a data engineering role with subject matter expertise in data tooling and concepts Required
1+ year(s) of experience in Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, or Amazon Web Services a plus. Preferred
Or equivalent combination of education and/or experience
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities, Behaviors:
Advanced knowledge and application of SQL required, with preferred experience in MSSQL and Teradata.
Proficient with programming languages with curiosity to learn more.
Extensive expertise/experience in data analysis, modeling and visualization.
Strong working knowledge of ETL processes and capabilities (e.g. SSIS).
Familiarity with multiple business intelligence platforms (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, SSRS).
Ability to think strategically about a problem across platforms.
Enables efficient front-end and BI development.
Extensive expertise/experience in the areas of data structures and data warehousing.
Ability to troubleshoot and resolve a wide range of complex issues in creative ways.
Proven ability to work in a team environment or independently as needed.
ITG transforms healthcare and gives people healthier tomorrows. We deliver information technology strategy, support, and solutions. ITG improve and enhance patient care and business operations. We deliver services at administrative locations, data centers, and hospitals. The facilities we support are located in 20+ states and the United Kingdom. Our team works to move healthcare forward. We do this by seeking, embracing, developing, and delivering technology for patient care.
HCA Healthcare has been recognized as one of the World’s Most Ethical Companies® by the Ethisphere Institute more than ten times. In recent years, HCA Healthcare spent an estimated $3.7 billion in cost for the delivery of charitable care, uninsured discounts, and other uncompensated expenses.
'Good people beget good people.'- Dr. Thomas Frist, Sr.
HCA Healthcare Co-Founder
We are a family 270,000 dedicated professionals! Our Talent Acquisition team is reviewing applications for our Senior Data Engineer opening. Qualified candidates will be contacted for interviews. Submit your resume today to join our community of caring!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

In addition, for the last five years we’ve been named in the 100 “World’s Most Innovative Companies” by Forbes Magazine.

post_title: Ugam, Merkle_Data Engineer_IC Senior_Sr. Software Engineer_155 (PySpark, Airflow)
description:
Company Description
   Ugam, a Merkle company, is a leading analytics and technology services company. Our customer-centric approach delivers impactful business results for large corporations by leveraging data, technology, and expertise. We consistently deliver superior, impactful results through the right blend of human intelligence and AI. With 4600+ people spread across locations worldwide, we successfully deploy our services to create success stories across industries like Retail & Consumer Brands, High Tech, BFSI, Distribution, and Market Research & Consulting. Over the past 21 years, Ugam has been recognized by several firms including Forrester and Gartner, named the No.1 data science company in India by Analytics Insight, and certified as a Great Place to Work®.  The name Ugam comes from the ancient Sanskrit language and means “source” or “origin.” Ugam seeks to be the source of solutions for the complex problems of retailers, brands and market research firms worldwide. The name signifies the company’s position as a pioneer in the market for data and analytics, and the source of relevant actionable insights for clients.



  Job Description
   Ugam, a Merkle company and part Dentsu, is looking for Senior Software Engineer (Data Engineer).
 This role is responsible to architect, develop and optimize petabyte scale data transformations pipelines and data platforms with smart fault tolerance and monitoring capabilities. You will design strategies to integrate ML models within the data flows using state-of-the art GCP environments such as Composer, Dataproc, BiqQuery, BQML, VertexAI etc.
 The ideal candidate will develop production quality python, pyspark and Ariflow code and mentor teams members. S/he will talk to business, participate in solution design, and build standards and best practices to address short- and long-term needs of the business (documentations, frameworks, boilerplate abstractions etc.)
 Role: Senior Software Engineer (Data Engineer)
 Key Responsibilities:

 Build pipelines to manage audience data for personalised marketing campaigns, integrate audience data from various sources to build one view of the customer
 Perform experimentation at scale by tagging audiences based on complex hierarchy of customer, product, and regional factors
 Responsible for development of the workflow orchestration & ETL pipelines within marketing's analytics and data science platforms. You will ensure that the data pipeline infrastructure meets the analysis, reporting, and data science needs of the marketing organization.
 Implement continued design, development and optimization of the marketing data pipelines & data prep infrastructure built on cutting-edge cloud technologies.
 Embrace an active team role to help design, implement, and launch efficient and reliable data pipelines moving data across several platforms including Data Warehouse, online caches, and real-time systems.
 Create data architecture that is flexible, scalable, and consistent for cross-functional use, and aligned to stakeholder business requirements.
 Deploy workflow orchestration and demonstrate expertise in data modeling, ETL development, and data warehousing
 Validate Data Engineering business data elements, organizational and business intelligence architecture designs for engineering functional areas from Dashboards, Data Lakes, Data Operations, ML - AI, and upstream/downstream intake and output processes




  Qualifications
  

 BA/BS Degree in Computer Science, any Engineering discipline, Statistics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.

 Experience

 5+ years of industry experience in data engineering, data science, or related field with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets
 Work experience with developers and business areas to design, configure, deploy, and maintain custom ETL Infrastructure to support project initiatives
 Experience in interacting with multiple teams, client stakeholders and able to fix the issues in a shorter span of time

 Technical/Domain

 Experience building and managing data pipelines and repositories in cloud environments such as Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure or AWS
 Experience in Airflow is a must
 Experience extracting/cleansing data and generating insights from large transactional data sets using Spark SQL, SQL, Python, and PySpark on cloud
 Experience with optimizing Spark pipelines on Dataproc, Databricks or similar technologies.

 Competencies (Behavioural)

 Must have exceptional and effective communication, organization, and time management skills
 Must be pro-active and determined (Initiates action, Analytical and problem solver)

 Additional Information
   All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

post_title: Data Engineer_Advance Analytics Engineer_IC Senior_Sr. Software Engineer_180
description:
Company Description
   Ugam, a Merkle company, is a leading analytics and technology services company. Our customer-centric approach delivers impactful business results for large corporations by leveraging data, technology, and expertise. We consistently deliver superior, impactful results through the right blend of human intelligence and AI. With 4600+ people spread across locations worldwide, we successfully deploy our services to create success stories across industries like Retail & Consumer Brands, High Tech, BFSI, Distribution, and Market Research & Consulting. Over the past 21 years, Ugam has been recognized by several firms including Forrester and Gartner, named the No.1 data science company in India by Analytics Insight, and certified as a Great Place to Work®.  The name Ugam comes from the ancient Sanskrit language and means “source” or “origin.” Ugam seeks to be the source of solutions for the complex problems of retailers, brands and market research firms worldwide. The name signifies the company’s position as a pioneer in the market for data and analytics, and the source of relevant actionable insights for clients.



  Job Description
   Ugam, a Merkle company and part of Dentsu, is looking for a Senior Software Engineer (Advanced Analytics)
 This role is responsible for building intelligent data platforms for top-tier global organizations in the areas of marketing & customer analytics, eCommerce & merchandising analytics. In this role, you will work closely with client leaders to understand their business problems and consult on data-driven approaches to inform or solve them. This will involve building complex data pipelines and integrated algorithms to process very large data sets across hundreds of features and KPIs to deliver actionable insights at scale.
 Typical problem statements involve (a mix of) measuring the impact of interventions on marketing or product outcomes, structuring & developing email targeting and product discounting frameworks to drive growth, leveraging market data to drive tactical and strategic competitive strategies around pricing and assortments, identifying fraudulent transactions, generating automated insights at scale, developing intuitive data stories to drive granular visibility into marketing, operational and business performance. To crush this role, you will need technical acumen to derive data driven solutions, and consulting experience to perform effective problem inquiry and synthesize analytical outcomes, to present insights to senior leaders driving actionability and impact.
 Role: Senior Software Engineer (Advanced Analytics)
 Key Responsibilities:

 Code custom packages, pipelines, testing & auditing frameworks using Python & SQL, that follow industry best practices in Python & SQL
 Research and build new algorithms making appropriate use of baseline, ensemble, and deep learning techniques
 Work closely with clients to discuss and understand their business needs; work with clients to achieve business impact/excellence by helping them implement data driven decision through solutions provided by Ugam
 Scope work-effort and develop plans involving a global team; mentor, coach and guide junior members of the team to increase operational efficiency, quality of the solution and to provide upskill opportunity where needed
 Support organizational efforts towards team engagement and performance management, be involved in performance reviews and provide consistent & constructive feedback to grow team’s capabilities
 Consult on data strategies and own the execution of those strategies when needed
 Focus on analyst efficiencies and drive automation of commonly occurring requests
 When requested participate in AC growth related initiatives (building proposals for new projects etc.)




  Qualifications
   Bachelor’s in computer science (preferred), Statistics (preferred), any other engineering

 Master of Science in Statistics, Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, and related fields)

 Experience

 4-6 years in data engineering, analytics & consulting services, demonstrating:
 Extensive software development experience
 Applying statistical techniques to business problems & building for scale
 Engaging with, and presenting to senior leaders
 Building compelling self-serve analytics tools (dashboards)
 Synthesizing insights to build strong perspectives and drive decisioning

 Technical/Domain

 Very good programming fundamentals (in Python)
 High proficiency in statistical modeling using Python
 Proficiency in complex querying, joining and manipulating raw datasets for analysis using SQL
 Good data storytelling skills using PowerPoint
 Proficiency in Tableau (or PowerBI / Spotfire / Looker)
 Good understanding of Business finance

 Behavioral

 High engagement skills, led by good communication & listening skills
 Curious minded and detail-oriented
 Must be pro-active and determined (Initiates action, Analytical and problem solver)
 Must be able to work with tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment

 Additional Information
   All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Location



 Whilst you may have any of our UK offices as a base location, you must be fully flexible in terms of assignment location, as these roles may involve periods of time away from home during the week at short notice. Capgemini requires our employees to be geographically mobile and to be able to travel to customer site to perform our jobs.




 Who you’ll be working with


 
The Cloud Data Platforms team is part of the Insights and Data Global Practice and has seen strong growth and continued success across a variety of projects and sectors. Cloud Data Platforms is the home of the Data Engineers, Platform Engineers, Solutions Architects and Business Analysts who are focused on driving our customers digital and data transformation journey using the modern cloud platforms. We specialise on using the latest frameworks, reference architectures and technologies using AWS, Azure and GCP.
 We continue to grow and are looking for talented individuals who want to join our high performing team. If you would like to develop your career as part of a team of highly skilled professionals who are passionate about increasing the value of the data and analytics in organisations you have come to the right place.




 The focus of your role



 We are looking for strong Azure Data Engineers who are passionate about Microsoft technology and who ideally have skills in many of the following areas:


 Build and deliver Azure data engineering solutions as part of a larger project
Build relationships with client stakeholders to establish a high-level of rapport and confidence
Work with clients, local teams and offshore resources to deliver modern data products
Work effectively on client sites, Capgemini offices and from home
Design and build modern data pipelines and data streams using Microsoft tools
Use Microsoft Data focused Reference Architecture
Design and build data service APIs
Expose data to end users using Power BI, Azure API Apps or other modern visualization platforms or experience
Analyze current business practices, processes and procedures and identify future opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure data & analytics PaaS services
Design solutions and support the planning and implementation of data platform services including sizing, configuration, and needs assessment
Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes

 Influencing and supporting project delivery through involvement in project/sprint planning and QA




 Experience with Agile methodology

 Nice to have




 Azure DevOps



 Python




 .NET




 Snowflake




 Databricks






 What we’ll offer you



 Professional development. Accelerated career progression. An environment that encourages entrepreneurial spirit. It’s all on offer at Capgemini. And although collaboration is at the core of the way we work, we also recognise individual needs with a flexible benefits package you can tailor to suit you.




 Why were different



 At Capgemini, we help organisations across the world become more agile, more competitive and more successful. Smart, tailored, often-groundbreaking technical solutions to complex problems are the norm. But so, too, is a culture that’s as collaborative as it is forward thinking. Working closely with each other, and with our clients, we get under the skin of businesses and to the heart of their goals. You will too.
 Capgemini is proud to represent nearly 130 nationalities and its cultural diversity. Our holistic definition of diversity extends beyond gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, ethnicity, race, age and religion. Capgemini views diversity as everything that makes us who we are as an organization, including our social background, our experiences in life and work, our communication styles and even our personality. These dimensions contribute to the type of diversity we value the most: diversity of thought.




 About Capgemini


 Capgemini is a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services. The Group is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year+ heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company of 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of €17billion. Discover more about what Capgemini can offer you. info_remote: JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A. - 8,668 reviews - Glasgow
description:
Client Intelligence is a platform that provides analytics on clients, deals, bankers, products, and profitability measures at the detail and aggregated level across key business metrics and dimensions. It contains a service-oriented, secure and scalable information platform; it is a corporate finance dashboard targeted at senior and junior bankers across different lines of business within the firm. 
  
 GIBIE serves as data warehouse for Banking and Research, Client Profitability/Analytics for IB Markets and Whole Client Profitability system for the Firm. The warehouse has five data marts and feeds to 20+ downstream systems. The platform uses many tools including Informatica and Oracle. GIBIE is one of the biggest database clusters in the Firm and runs about 2000 jobs every day. 
  
 In the short to medium term, we are looking for a Data Warehouse Developer who is proficient in database and ETL implementations to support GIBIE platform. In the long term, we are migrating to a cloud based refactored platform. The role would then pivot to DevOps, delivering Infrastructure as Code and cloud scripting and automation for continuous deployment and integration (CI/CD). 
  
 Key Requirement 
  

Ability to work in a highly energetic global environment showing ability to quickly overcome technical challenges and respond appropriately. 
Experience in working on projects with demanding timelines. 
Keeps abreast of industry trends and able to bring industry standards and best practices, lessons learned to projects. 
Strong communication skills as this individual will need to work closely with clients, users and managers. 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Good team player, gets on well with others and able to work with people of different skill levels. 
An understanding of quality and process improvement. 
Good organization skills to keep track of issues & requests and ensure proper follow-up and closure 

 3+ year experience and hands on proficiency in the following tools/skill sets are a must: Informatica, Oracle and UNIX scripting, delivering high quality solutions. 
  

SDLC lifecycle experience leading development efforts within data warehouse environment with complex dataflow and data integration from multiple sources with different integration strategies (push vs pull, file vs database, etc.). 
Knowledgeable with data warehouse concepts such as: SCDs, star schema, hierarchy, aggregation. 
Demonstrated ability to understand and work effectively within complex IT environment containing onshore/offshore model, multiple development and testing environments, sharing of environment with multiple teams, load balancing and disaster recovery setup. 
Ability to quickly grasp problems and issues and communicate effectively with other team members. 
Understanding of development using SCRUM and Agile practices 
Possess good written and oral communications skills 


Interested? This is what you will have: 
 A commercial mindset to deliver short, medium and long term strategies to achieve sustained efficiency; an innovation mindset; focus on simplification; and help the team adopt SDLC automation/DevOps to maximize ROI of technology investments. An exciting opportunity to deliver value using a variety of technologies
   J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
 We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

 As a Data Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in the expansion of a high-funded FinTech, influencing data engineering projects to allow the cross-functional teams to make better data-driven decisions. You will have proficiency in Python, a strong cloud background (open to GCP, AWS, Azure), and a passion to join a globally recognised FinTech team that has completed $50m in series B funding.

We have a current opportunity for a Data Engineer to work with our public sector client on a number of Health Data projects. The role can be be performed from anywhere in the UK with only 1 day per quarter required on site for a quarterly meeting.
 This position requires someone who can think laterally, someone with the confidence to question established practices and look at innovative ways to solve complex health data management problems. Being proactive, with a can-do attitude will be a distinct advantage.
 You must be able to work alone, and to agreed client deadlines. You must also be able to steward projects to completion, provide support for others and take ownership, driving key work areas within the data team.
 You will regularly be required to communicate clearly on complex and specialised issues both orally and in writing, often to non-specialists and may be required to draft revised policies, procedures and processes within own work area.
 As part of an ISO27001 accredited organisation, you'll be expected to be part of data governance, the use of privacy enhancing technologies, third parties, and other methods essential for the safe use of patient data.
 Other duties include;

 Be the primary point of communication with clients, managing day to day project progress and ensuring rigorous and timely delivery of tasks
 Explaining technical processes to clients and support them throughout projects
 Working with the information Governance manager to draft technical/governance documentation and data management plans
 Undertaking data mapping and performing data analysis/engineering
 Using the clinical data repository to identify and create data extracts for clinical research purposes.
 Routine and ad-hoc data curation activities requiring hands-on development of bespoke data transformation using cleaning scripts in languages such as SQL and Python.
 Maintain and enhance security policies deployed to protect unauthorised access to the data, while supporting research and operating in an ISO27001 accredited organisation.

 Skills/Experience Required;

 Experience in cleaning, processing, managing and manipulating of datasets
 Client relationship management specifically experience of working with clients to understand their requirements and be able to create solutions that meet these requirements.
 Experience in ETL techniques, tools (including Python, or similar) and design.
 Experience in cleaning, processing, managing and manipulating of large datasets
 Experience with physical relational (and ideally non-relational) database design.
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills to technical staff, senior management and non-technical partners.
 Excellent relational database skills, with an emphasis on T-SQL scripting skills and MS SQL.

 Benefits;

 Remote working
 39 Days Annual Leave
 21% Employer pension contribution

 Morgan Hunt is a multi-award-winning recruitment business for interim, contract and temporary recruitment and acts as an Employment Agency in relation to permanent vacancies. Morgan Hunt is an equal opportunities employer. Job suitability is assessed on merit in accordance with the individual's skills, qualifications and abilities to perform the relevant duties required in a particular role.

The details

A full-time role in a fast-growing sports marketing software company building solutions for high profile sports clubs, leagues and federations
The salary is competitive based on experience
You will be based in Brighton or fully remote

Who are we?
 InCrowd is a data-led fan marketing company, but first and foremost, we are sports fans. We understand the unrivalled passion and dedication of supporters towards the clubs, leagues and players they care about. We have thrived during the recent pandemic as our clients recognise that they need to create better direct relationships with their fans.
 We use technology to capture real-time fan consumption data and have enterprise-scale third-party data integrations enabling our clients to gain a deeper understanding of their fans, going well beyond who they are and delving deeper into their behavioural habits and fan characteristics. This approach allows our clients to drive business intelligence and to deliver relevant and timely content and marketing messages to fans, via InCrowd’s content and messaging tools.
 InCrowd’s core digital experience platform (DXP) powers official mobile apps and websites, personalised fan messaging and LED and Big Screens in over 140 stadiums around the world, utilising first-party and behavioural data.
 We work with multiple globally recognised sports organisations and clubs including…

Formula 1
ECB / ICC / IPL
FIFA/UEFA/EFL plus numerous Premier League & Championship football clubs
The Rugby Football League / Premiership Rugby / PRO14 / Six Nations
World Snooker

We have seen rapid growth in our short history and now have a team of nearly 70 across London and Brighton as well as individuals in Australia and Hong Kong.
 Who are you?
 We are looking for a mature Data Engineer with at least 3+ years of industry experience to join our Backend and Data Team.
 What will you be doing for InCrowd?

Developing software in Python
Developing micro services and deploying on Kubernetes
Connecting micro services with Event Bus and gRPC technologies
Deploying and maintaining CI/CD pipelines for your projects (we use Bitbucket pipelines)
Building ETL pipelines in Python to support our Big Data and CRM projects
Developing at scale – our newest app has over 2.5 million active users!
Working with our data lake built on Dremio
Building marketing and communication tools for sports clubs to communicate with fans
Supporting Data Scientists and building tools and workflows to implement their models
Data modelling using tools such as dbt

We need you to have:

At least 3+ Years of experience in the industry
Computer Science Degree or equivalent to a high standard – First or Masters
Knowledge of relational (PostgreSQL etc) and non databases (MongoDB etc)
Good knowledge of SQL
Knowledge of Python
Knowledge of Python and workflow automations tools such as Apache Airflow and Prefect
Some experience in containerisation with Docker / Kubernetes would be beneﬁcial as our stack is built upon these technologies but not essential

What will InCrowd be doing for you?

A friendly but challenging working environment
A great work-life balance. We have moved to the new normal where we offer the option to work from home or other quiet environments, but combined with the opportunity to come together for collaboration, team building and social events
Company benefits include 25 days holiday, pension contributions, cycle and transport schemes, working from home support schemes and provision of quality technical equipment.
Support for additional training and education

Lastly, we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, or disability status.
 Up for the challenge?
 Send us your CV to jobs@incrowdsports.com, your salary expectations and something that shows us why you’re perfect for the role. This can be anything; a letter, a video or perhaps a case study of previous work….. we want to find out more about you.

post_title: Senior Data Engineer - AI for 6G wireless communications - Join the R&D center
description:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) will be an integral component of the upcoming 6G mobile networks. We use AI to innovate and build new services, change the way we communicate and drive the evolution of mobile communications. Our goal is to build optimized and highly automated systems to realize Ericsson’s vision of a zero-touch cognitive network platform.
We are looking for Data Scientists and Data Engineers who get inspired by technology and the opportunities of AI, solving complex problems in an international team.
You have experience in data science theory and methodologies as well as telecom systems, specifically radio networks. As a Data Scientist/Engineer, you have strong programming skills and deep understanding of data science/engineering and Machine Learning tools. Together with the team, you will apply them to address new, exciting real-world problems and to pioneer and develop new AI and telecom solutions for the 6G network. You will be part of a highly dynamic and globally distributed team, working on AI research and development projects. Together with other domain experts, you jointly will drive portfolio innovation and evolution in the areas of data driven network, distributed cloud, IoT and other emerging businesses.
Are you the one!
To be successful in the role you …
Conduct functional and technical analysis and studies on AI technology, functionality, and strategic customer needs as basis for development for new functionality and use cases.
Contribute to rapid and iterative development of high-quality AI applications. This includes working with solutions for 5G/6G networks, IoT and data and AI systems.
Collaborate with international product development teams and partners in Ericsson business to industrialize solutions as part of Ericsson product and service portfolio.
Work with new technologies and champion them within Ericsson AI communities.
Engage with external ecosystem (academia, technology leaders, open source, etc.) to develop skills and technology portfolio.
Stay updated with the latest trends in research and technology, contributing with publications, patents and technology innovation.
Position Qualifications:
MSc, or PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or related field (e.g. applied mathematics/statistics).
Programming skills in various languages with proficiency in Python or C++ or Go
Solid understanding of Machine Learning theory and application in real-life use cases. Proven skills and track record in the use of current AI frameworks such as Python, R, Scala, Tensorflow, SciKit, ONNX, PyTorch, Spark etc.
Experience of data engineering and data handling technologies and tools like SQL/NoSQL, Spark, Kafka, ElasticSearch, Airflow, Kublefow, NIFI and knowledge of Cloud technologies, Helm, Kubernetes, Docker and tooling.
Applications/ domain-knowledge in telecommunication and/or IoT.
Strong analytical skills and drive to acquire new knowledge and apply it in the job.
Good communication skills in written and spoken English.
Creativity and ability to formulate problems and tackle them independently.
Experience in writing and presenting papers, journal articles and technical blogs on the results.
Ability to work in a collaborative and environment, working with multiple stakeholder business units, global customers, technology and other ecosystem partners in a multi-culture, global organization with sensitivity and persistence.

Are you ready for the next step in your career? Then you need to keep reading! When we’re looking to hire at Amadeus, we look internally first. Our teams get the benefit of your experience and you get more chances to grow and progress. So, if you are ready for a new challenge and want to drive your career, apply now!
 Purpose

 The world is evolving at an unpredictable fast pace. The impact from COVID on travel industry was abismal but it will also open huge set of opportunities. Just to name a few, airlines need to reinforce their retailing capabilities to increase revenues; they need to understand the impact of COVID on behavior of different customer groups in order to optimize the offer accordingly; when is the right time to position the ancillary offer and at what price, etc. All these topics are covered by the Airlines Data Unit which is a team inside Travel Unit specialized in analytics and Data Science based on Airlines data. The aim of this unit is to provide Data Science Services to internal and external Amadeus customers enabling the use of the power of analytics to unlock business values.
 The main purpose of this role is to support Amadeus Airlines external and internal customers in terms of Data Engineering. As a Data Engineer, you will develop and deploy Big Data solutions on Amadeus’ Business Intelligence Platform. You will be working on Azure cloud, mostly using Databricks, Spark, Azure ML, Databricks Scheduler and/or Airflow. You will be writing code in Scala/Python and will also support the team with tooling, maintenance and configuration of the platforms tools for a better experience.

 Key accountabilities
 
Leading :

Combine Databricks, Spark, Airflow, Snowflake or similar for transofmring RAW into actionable data and develop libraries for data preparation
Write code and tests in Scala, Spark, Python
Desing data pipelines
Automate data processes
Work closely with data scientists and devops in order to create and industrialize advanced analytics solutions


 Collaborative :

Provide data engineering support for internal & external data needs for products, sales, and consulting missions
Assist in client interviews and meetings for internal & external data science missions
Communicate and translate data pipeline decisions & their implications to business stakeholders
Collect and manage large data sets
Provide expertise on architectures and support platform migrations across networks and data centers
Define the necessary infrastructure and services to deploy Big Data solutions on Amadeus’ Business Intelligence


 Supportive :

Formulate the customer and business problems into data problems
Provide guidance to employees, colleagues and customers
Maintain technical, functional, business and commercial awareness
Participate in hiring priocess (interviews and candidate screening) for new team members


 Work Experience

 1-3 years working as a software engineer, big data developer or similar role.

 Education

 Engineering degree, M.S. or Ph.D. in a relevant technical field, computer science and applications, modeling, statistics, analytics and math.

 Skills




 Computing
    

Strong experience in diverse programming paradigms (Scala, Spark, R, C++, Python...)

Strong experience in version control with Git and Linux shell

Good understanding of database technologies: relational, distributed, SQL/NoSQL

Experience in manipulating high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources

Experience in designing data pipelines and process automation

Solid understanding of Application DevOps, CI/CD pipelines and tooling (SWWorkbench, TeamCity, Azure Devops, etc.)

Experience in one or more Big Data products (Databricks, Dataflow, BigQuery, Apache Hadoop, Spark, Beam, Kafka, Cassandra, Impala etc)

Experience with Business Intelligence vendor software (like MicroStrategy, SAP/BO, IBM SPSS, Oracle BI, Microsoft PowerBI, SAS, Tableau, Qlik)





      Languages
    
Fluent in written and verbal English; a second language very useful (e.g Spanish, German or French)




      Specific knowledge
    


Flexible analytic approach that allows for results at varying levels of precision

Abaility to write software in coordination with a team distributed across the globe

Strong business acumen

Good communication skills





      Other
    

Excellent general culture

Capacity to adapt to the fast-paced environment

 Mettre en production les données dans l’écosystème Big Data.


 Profil recherché

 Profil recherché :
 Vous êtes issu(e) d’une formation supérieure Bac+5 (Ecole d’ingénieur, Université), et possédez une expérience de minimum 2 ans en tant que Data Engineer.

 Vous savez développer dans des langages tels que : Spark, Scala, Python;
 Vous possédez une expertise dans le stockage de données et les outils ETL (Talend, Stambia…);
 Vous avez des connaissances en solutions de bases de données (SQL, NoSQL…);
 Vous maîtrisez des conceptions de Data Warehouse, Data Lake et Data Hub ainsi que des technologies Big Data;
 Vous connaissez des environnements Cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure, Snowflake…);
 Vous manipulez des données grâce à Hadoop, Spark, ou encore Kafka…;
 Vous êtes rigoureux, méthodique, organisé et vous savez faire preuve d’autonomie et de réactivité.

 Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.
 Langue : L’anglais est un +  Ce poste vous inspire, vous maîtrisez les périmètres techniques cités avec les niveaux adéquats ?
 Vous aimez les challenges, êtes motivé(e), curieux, vous avez envie d’apprendre continuellement et de monter en compétences ?
 N’hésitez plus et postulez au sein d’une société HappyAtWork & TechAtWork !


 Entreprise

 NOVA TECHNOLOGY est une société de conseil à taille humaine de 180 consultants créée en 2006 et basée à Saint-Cloud.
 Nous sommes présents sur les régions Île-de-France, Grand-Ouest, Hauts-de-France à travers nos agences de Paris, Nantes, Lille.
 Nous accompagnons nos clients dans la réalisation de leurs projets digitaux, en régie ou au forfait. Nos consultants, aux profils fonctionnels et techniques, interviennent à chaque étape de projets innovants et multi-sectoriels.
 Notre expertise

 Langage : Java, .NET / #C, PHP, Python, Angular / VueJS, Javascript, Drupal / WordPress
 Décisionnel : MSBI, Talend, Qlik, Tableau
 DevOps : Infrastructure, Kubernetes, Aws / GCP / Azure, Ansible, Docker, Jenkins
 Agile : Scrum/Kanban /Safe

 Nous sommes labellisés Happy At Work 2018, 2019, 2020 mais également Agile At Work 2019 et Happy Tech 2020.
 Rejoignez-nous ! https//www.nova-technology.fr/




 





Processus de recrutement


 On s’appelle, si on a des atomes crochus on se fixe un entretien !
 On se rencontre (en physique ou en visio, on s’adapte) ! Lors de cet échange tu vas discuter avec une RH, sur tes expériences et tes souhaits. Le feeling est là, poursuivons !
 On mise plutôt sur l’humain. Tu vas pouvoir échanger avec un expert, d’une part pour cartographier tes compétences et d’autre part te projeter au sein de Nova. Ton échange est concluant.
 Tu intègres notre #TeamNovaTechnology par à un parcours personnalisé !


 Personne en charge du recrutement Constance FOURURE - Chargée de recrutement

DATA ENGINEER F/H
 Ref. Apec : 168300420W 

VISIAN
 1
      
        CDI
       
Levallois-Perret - 92



 Publiée le 12/05/2022
 Actualisée le 12/05/2022



 







Salaire A négocier

 Descriptif du poste

 Visian a fait le choix de se spécialiser sur Python et les consultant(e)s de Visian sont même allés jusqu’à créer la PySquad pour s’entraider et développer un centre d’excellence autour de pratiques et de normes communes.
 La PySquad se donne pour mission de répondre efficacement aux enjeux de développement, d’accélération et d’industrialisation de projets innovants.
 Motivé(e)s par le challenge, l’envie de monter en compétences, le désir de partager ses connaissances et de s’enrichir continuellement de l’apport des autres, les consultant(e)s Visian forment une équipe dynamique, pleine d’idées et d’ambition.
 Nous recherchons pour notre client, un Data Engineer pour rejoindre son équipe.
 Contexte de la mission: Développement d’une application utilisée par les consommateurs de notre client.
 Missions principales:

Intégrations des flux de données via ETL déployé sur AWS (S3, Glue, lambda)
Intégration des données sur la plateforme C3.ai
Architecture et conceptions de solutions pour répondre aux nouveaux besoins métier
Développement d’APIs et de jobs de MapReduce pour exécuter les traitements Big Data.
Optimisation des performances des jobs et Apis.
Intégration et utilisation des modèles de Machine Learning.
Activité de RUN (gestion des incidents, KPI, analyse de logs, suivi du plan de prod…)
Monitoring des services sur Splunk, Grafana.
Ecriture de tests fonctionnels et unitaires pour assurer la qualité de delivery.
Documentation
Participation aux rituels Agiles (SAFe)
Encadrement des autres développeurs pour assurer les bonnes pratiques de développement et la qualité de code
